Performs Attribute Ranged Retrieval https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/adsi/attribute-range-retrieval The function self-determines the range and internally handles the maximum step allowed by the server

QueryLDAP(String, SearchScope, String[], String, Boolean, Boolean, String, Boolean, Boolean)

Performs an LDAP query using the parameters specified by the user.

Declaration
public static IEnumerable<SearchResultEntry> QueryLDAP(string ldapFilter, SearchScope scope, string[] props, string domainName = null, bool includeAcl = false, bool showDeleted = false, string adsPath = null, bool globalCatalog = false, bool skipCache = false)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String ldapFilter

LDAP filter
System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchScope scope

SearchScope to query
System.String[] props

LDAP properties to fetch for each object
System.String domainName

Domain to query
System.Boolean includeAcl

Include the DACL and Owner values in the NTSecurityDescriptor
System.Boolean showDeleted

Include deleted objects
System.String adsPath

ADS path to limit the query too
System.Boolean globalCatalog

Use the global catalog instead of the regular LDAP server
System.Boolean skipCache

Skip the connection cache and force a new connection. You must dispose of this connection yourself.
Returns
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.SearchResultEntry>

All LDAP search results matching the specified parameters
